page.title: 09LOXLEY " TOP CHAPEL "
page.content: {Loxley United Reformed Church,}known locally as the{"Top Chapel,"}was built in 1787 at a cost of Â£1000 by some of the congregation of Bradfield Church. It was built for the curate at Bradfield, who was about to be dismissed, by parishioners who wanted him to stay in the area. The bishop was asked to consecrate it but he refused because it hadn't a window in the East wall. It is an attractive stone building in large grounds. It could be mistaken for a large house rather than a Church. It is still used for services and the local cubs and scouts use it as their base. The surrounding grounds are a useful campsite for them.
